info.title: LabServicesClient
info.description: REST API for managing Azure Lab Services images.

AadOauth2Auth.description: The Azure Active Directory OAuth2 Flow

get.description: List the operations for the provider
Returns a list of all lab plans within a subscription
Returns a list of all labs for a subscription.
Returns list of usage per SKU family for the specified subscription in the specified region.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The location name.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: The filter to apply to the operation.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

get.summary: Gets the Azure Lab Services resource SKUs.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: The filter to apply to the operation.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

get.description: Returns a list of all lab plans for a subscription and resource group.
Retrieves the properties of a Lab Plan.

parameters.name: labPlanName
parameters.description: The name of the lab plan that uniquely identifies it within containing resource group. Used in resource URIs and in UI.

parameters.name: labPlanName

parameters.description: The request body.

Location.description: The Location header contains the URL where the status of the long running operation can be checked.

delete.description: Operation to delete a Lab Plan resource. Deleting a lab plan does not delete labs associated with a lab plan, nor does it delete shared images added to a gallery via the lab plan permission container.

AutoShutdownProfile.description: Profile for how to handle shutting down virtual machines.

shutdownOnDisconnect.description: Whether shutdown on disconnect is enabled

shutdownWhenNotConnected.description: Whether a VM will get shutdown when it hasn't been connected to after a period of time.

shutdownOnIdle.description: Whether a VM will get shutdown when it has idled for a period of time.

disconnectDelay.description: The amount of time a VM will stay running after a user disconnects if this behavior is enabled.

noConnectDelay.description: The amount of time a VM will stay running before it is shutdown if no connection is made and this behavior is enabled.

idleDelay.description: The amount of time a VM will idle before it is shutdown if this behavior is enabled.

capacity.description: The scale out/in options of the SKU.

locations.description: List of locations that are available for a size.

costs.description: Metadata for retrieving price info of a lab services SKUs.

restrictions.description: Restrictions of a lab services SKUs.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

message.description: A human-readable representation of the error.

details.description: An array of details about specific errors that led to this reported error.

innererror.description: An object containing more specific information than the current object about the error.

Azure.Core.Foundations.InnerError.description: An object containing more specific information about the error. As per Microsoft One API guidelines - https://github.com/Microsoft/api-guidelines/blob/vNext/Guidelines.md#7102-error-condition-responses.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

Azure.ResourceManager.Foundations.SkuTie.description: Available service tiers for the SKU.

ConnectionProfile.description: Connection profile for how users connect to lab virtual machines.

webSshAccess.description: The enabled access level for Web Access over SSH.

webRdpAccess.description: The enabled access level for Web Access over RDP.

clientSshAccess.description: The enabled access level for Client Access over SSH.

clientRdpAccess.description: The enabled access level for Client Access over RDP.

ConnectionType.description: A connection type for access labs and VMs (Public, Private or None).

CreateOption.description: Indicates what lab virtual machines are created from.

values.name: Image
values.description: An image is used to create all lab user virtual machines. When this option is set, no template VM will be created.

values.name: TemplateVM
values.description: A template VM will be used to create all lab user virtual machines.

Credentials.description: Credentials for a user on a lab VM.

username.description: The username to use when signing in to lab VMs.

password.description: The password for the user. This is required for the TemplateVM createOption.

principalId.description: The principal ID of resource identity.

ImageListResult.description: The response of a Image list operation.

value.description: The Image items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

provisioningState.description: Current provisioning state of the image.

osType.description: The OS Type of the image.

plan.description: The ID of marketplace plan associated with the image (optional).

termsStatus.description: The status of image terms of use (enabled = accepted, disabled = not accepted).

offer.description: The ID of an offer associated with the image.

publisher.description: The ID of the publisher of the image.

sharedGalleryId.description: The ID for the image in the shared gallery.

availableRegions.description: The available regions of the image in the shared gallery.

osState.description: The OS State of the image.

ImageReference.description: Image reference information. Used in the virtual machine profile.

version.description: The image version specified on creation.

exactVersion.description: The actual version of the image after use.

ImageUpdate.description: Lab services virtual machine image for updates.

ImageUpdateProperties.description: Properties of an image resource update

values.name: NotSent
values.description: The invitation has not been sent.

values.name: Sent
values.description: The invitation has been successfully sent.

values.name: Failed
values.description: There was an error while sending the invitation.

InviteBody.description: Body for a user invite request

text.description: Custom text for the invite email.

LabListResult.description: The response of a Lab list operation.

value.description: The Lab items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

LabNetworkProfile.description: Profile for how to handle networking for Labs.

loadBalancerId.description: The external load balancer resource id

publicIpId.description: The external public IP resource id

LabPlan.description: Lab Plans act as a permission container for creating labs via labs.azure.com. Additionally, they can provide a set of default configurations that will apply at the time of creating a lab, but these defaults can still be overwritten.

identity.description: The managed service identities assigned to this resource.

LabPlanListResult.description: The response of a LabPlan list operation.

value.description: The LabPlan items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

LabPlanNetworkProfile.description: Profile for how to handle networking for Lab Plans.

provisioningState.description: Current provisioning state of the lab plan.

LabPlanUpdate.description: Contains lab configuration and default settings. This variant is used for PATCH.

LabPlanUpdateProperties.description: Lab plan resource properties for updates

defaultConnectionProfile.description: The default lab connection profile. This can be changed on a lab resource and only provides a default profile.

defaultAutoShutdownProfile.description: The default lab shutdown profile. This can be changed on a lab resource and only provides a default profile.

defaultNetworkProfile.description: The lab plan network profile. To enforce lab network policies they must be defined here and cannot be changed when there are existing labs associated with this lab plan.

allowedRegions.description: The allowed regions for the lab creator to use when creating labs using this lab plan.

sharedGalleryId.description: Resource ID of the Shared Image Gallery attached to this lab plan. When saving a lab template virtual machine image it will be persisted in this gallery. Shared images from the gallery can be made available to use when creating new labs.

supportInfo.description: Support contact information and instructions for users of the lab plan. This information is displayed to lab owners and virtual machine users for all labs in the lab plan.

linkedLmsInstance.description: Base Url of the lms instance this lab plan can link lab rosters against.

provisioningState.description: Current provisioning state of the lab.

networkProfile.description: The network profile for the lab, typically applied via a lab plan. This profile cannot be modified once a lab has been created.

LabServicesSkuCapabilities.description: The array of capabilities of a lab services SKU.

name.description: The name of the capability for a SKU.

value.description: The value of the capability for a SKU.

LabServicesSkuCapacity.description: The scale out/in options of the SKU.

default.description: The default capacity for this resource.

minimum.description: The lowest permitted capacity for this resource.

maximum.description: The highest permitted capacity for this resource.

scaleType.description: The localized name of the resource.

LabServicesSkuCost.description: The array of costs of a lab services SKU.

LabState.description: The state of a virtual machine.

values.name: Draft
values.description: The lab is currently in draft (has not been published).

LabUpdateProperties.description: Properties of a lab resource used for updates.

autoShutdownProfile.description: The resource auto shutdown configuration for the lab. This controls whether actions are taken on resources that are sitting idle.

connectionProfile.description: The connection profile for the lab. This controls settings such as web access to lab resources or whether RDP or SSH ports are open.

virtualMachineProfile.description: The profile used for creating lab virtual machines.

rosterProfile.description: The lab user list management profile.

labPlanId.description: The ID of the lab plan. Used during resource creation to provide defaults and acts as a permission container when creating a lab via labs.azure.com. Setting a labPlanId on an existing lab provides organization..

id.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. Ex - /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}

error.description: The error for a failure if the operation failed.

values.name: NotStarted
values.description: The operation has been accepted but hasn't started.

values.name: Generalized
values.description: Image does not contain any machine and user specific information.

values.name: Specialized
values.description: Image contains machine and user specific information.

PagedAvailableLabServicesSku.description: Paged list of lab services skus.

value.description: The AvailableLabServicesSku items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

value.description: The Usage items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

values.name: Creating
values.description: Resource is in the process of being created.

values.name: Updating
values.description: New property values are being applied to the resource.

values.name: Deleting
values.description: Resource is in the process of being deleted.

values.name: Succeeded
values.description: Resource is in healthy state after creation or update operation.

values.name: Failed
values.description: Previous operation on the resource has failed leaving resource in unhealthy state.

values.name: Locked
values.description: The resource is locked and changes are currently blocked. This could be due to maintenance or a scheduled operation. The state will go back to succeeded once the locking operation has finished.

values.name: Weekly
values.description: Schedule will run every week on days specified in weekDays.

RecurrencePattern.description: Recurrence pattern of a lab schedule.

weekDays.description: The week days the schedule runs. Used for when the Frequency is set to Weekly.

interval.description: The interval to invoke the schedule on. For example, interval = 2 and RecurrenceFrequency.Daily will run every 2 days. When no interval is supplied, an interval of 1 is used.

expirationDate.description: When the recurrence will expire. This date is inclusive.

values.name: Registered
values.description: User has not yet registered with the lab.

values.name: NotRegistered
values.description: User has registered with the lab.

ResetPasswordBody.description: Body of a reset password request.

username.description: The user whose password is being reset

Resource.description: Common fields that are returned in the response for all Azure Resource Manager resources

id.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. Ex - /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}

type.description: The type of the resource. E.g. "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines" or "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts"

RosterProfile.description: The lab user list management profile.

activeDirectoryGroupId.description: The AAD group ID which this lab roster is populated from. Having this set enables AAD sync mode.

ltiContextId.description: The unique context identifier for the lab in the lms.

lmsInstance.description: The base URI identifying the lms instance.

ltiClientId.description: The unique id of the azure lab services tool in the lms.

ltiRosterEndpoint.description: The uri of the names and roles service endpoint on the lms for the class attached to this lab.

SaveImageBody.description: Body for the save image POST

name.description: The name for the image we create.

labVirtualMachineId.description: The ID of the lab virtual machine you want to save an image from.

ScaleType.description: The localized name of the resource.

values.name: None
values.description: The capacity is not adjustable in any way.

values.name: Manual
values.description: The user must manually scale this SKU in and out.

values.name: Automatic
values.description: The user is permitted to scale this SKU in and out.

Schedule.description: Schedule for automatically turning virtual machines in a lab on and off at specified times.

ScheduleListResult.description: The response of a Schedule list operation.

value.description: The Schedule items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

provisioningState.description: Current provisioning state of the schedule.

ScheduleUpdate.description: Schedule for automatically turning virtual machines in a lab on and off at specified times. Used for updates.

ScheduleUpdateProperties.description: Schedule resource properties used for updates.

startAt.description: When lab user virtual machines will be started. Timestamp offsets will be ignored and timeZoneId is used instead.

stopAt.description: When lab user virtual machines will be stopped. Timestamp offsets will be ignored and timeZoneId is used instead.

recurrencePattern.description: The recurrence pattern of the scheduled actions.

timeZoneId.description: The IANA timezone id for the schedule.

registrationCode.description: The registration code for the lab.

openAccess.description: Whether any user or only specified users can register to a lab.

ShutdownOnIdleMode.description: Defines whether to shut down VM on idle and the criteria for idle detection.

values.name: None
values.description: The VM won't be shut down when it is idle.

values.name: UserAbsence
values.description: The VM will be considered as idle when there is no keyboard or mouse input.

values.name: LowUsage
values.description: The VM will be considered as idle when user is absent and the resource (CPU and disk) consumption is low.

Sku.description: The resource model definition representing SKU

name.description: The name of the SKU. Ex - P3. It is typically a letter+number code

tier.description: This field is required to be implemented by the Resource Provider if the service has more than one tier, but is not required on a PUT.

size.description: The SKU size. When the name field is the combination of tier and some other value, this would be the standalone code.

family.description: If the service has different generations of hardware, for the same SKU, then that can be captured here.

capacity.description: If the SKU supports scale out/in then the capacity integer should be included. If scale out/in is not possible for the resource this may be omitted.

TrackedResourceUpdate.description: Base tracked resource type for all PATCH updates.

id.description: The fully qualified arm resource id.

localizedValue.description: The localized name of the resource.

User.description: User of a lab that can register for and use virtual machines within the lab.

UserListResult.description: The response of a User list operation.

value.description: The User items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

provisioningState.description: Current provisioning state of the user resource.

displayName.description: Display name of the user, for example user's full name.

registrationState.description: State of the user's registration within the lab.

invitationState.description: State of the invitation message for the user.

invitationSent.description: Date and time when the invitation message was sent to the user.

totalUsage.description: How long the user has used their virtual machines in this lab.

UserUpdate.description: User of a lab that can register for and use virtual machines within the lab. Used for updates.

UserUpdateProperties.description: User resource properties used for updates.

additionalUsageQuota.description: The amount of usage quota time the user gets in addition to the lab usage quota.

VirtualMachineAdditionalCapabilities.description: The additional capabilities for a lab VM.

installGpuDrivers.description: Flag to pre-install dedicated GPU drivers.

VirtualMachineConnectionProfile.description: The connection information for the virtual machine

privateIpAddress.description: The private IP address of the virtual machine.

sshAuthority.description: Port and host name separated by semicolon for connecting via SSH protocol to the virtual machine.

sshInBrowserUrl.description: URL for connecting via SSH protocol to the virtual machine in browser.

rdpAuthority.description: Port and host name separated by semicolon for connecting via RDP protocol to the virtual machine.

rdpInBrowserUrl.description: URL for connecting via RDP protocol to the virtual machine in browser.

adminUsername.description: The username used to log on to the virtual machine as admin.

nonAdminUsername.description: The username used to log on to the virtual machine as non-admin, if one exists.

VirtualMachineListResult.description: The response of a VirtualMachine list operation.

value.description: The VirtualMachine items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

VirtualMachineProfile.description: The base virtual machine configuration for a lab.

createOption.description: Indicates what lab virtual machines are created from.

imageReference.description: The image configuration for lab virtual machines.

osType.description: The OS type of the image

sku.description: The SKU for the lab. Defines the type of virtual machines used in the lab.

usageQuota.description: The initial quota alloted to each lab user. Must be a time span between 0 and 9999 hours.

useSharedPassword.description: Enabling this option will use the same password for all user VMs.

adminUser.description: Credentials for the admin user on the VM.

nonAdminUser.description: Credentials for the non-admin user on the VM, if one exists.

provisioningState.description: Current provisioning state of the virtual machine.

state.description: The current state of the virtual machine

connectionProfile.description: Profile for information about connecting to the virtual machine.

claimedByUserId.description: The lab user ID (not the PUID!) of who claimed the virtual machine.
